question.title: Remove character
question.content:
For a given a string(str) and a character X, write a function to remove all the occurrences of X from the given string.

The input string will remain unchanged if the given character(X) doesn't exist in the input string.

Input Format:
The first line of input contains a string without any leading and trailing spaces.

The second line of input contains a character(X) without any leading and trailing spaces.
Output Format:
The only line of output prints the updated string.
Note:
You are not required to print anything explicitly. It has already been taken care of.
Constraints:
0 <= N <= 10^6
Where N is the length of the input string.

Time Limit: 1 second
Sample Input 1:
aabccbaa
a
Sample Output 1:
bccb
Sample Input 2:
xxyyzxx
y
Sample Output 2:
xxzxx

rephrased.body: Given a string and a character, implement a function to create a new string by removing all occurrences of the specified character from the original string. If the character is not present in the string, return the original string unchanged.
constraints: 0 <= N <= 10^6, where N is the length of the input string.
The input string will not have any leading or trailing spaces.
The input character will not have any leading or trailing spaces.

testcases.explanation: All occurrences of 'a' are removed from 'aabccbaa', resulting in 'bccb'.
All occurrences of 'y' are removed from 'xxyyzxx', resulting in 'xxzxx'.
The character 'z' does not exist in the string 'abcdefg', so the original string is returned unchanged.
All characters in the string are 'a', which are removed, resulting in an empty string.
The input string is empty, so removing any character will still result in an empty string.
Removes the space character from the string 'hello world'.
Removes all occurrences of the character 'g'.
